name: So-Cal University Girl's Granola Bars
author: brittlynnr
summary: I adapted a few granola bars to fit my needs as a short-on-cash college kid. They're easy to adapt to what you have in your pantry and perfect to store individually for a healthy grab-and-go snack! Using dried cherries gives the bars a tarty edge! I recommend cutting bars and storing in refrigerator wrapped individually for grab-and-go snacking.
ingredients: ¾ cup chopped dried mixed fruit
1 tablespoon instant coffee granules, or more to taste  (Optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray
Mix oats, almond flour, dried fruit, rice cereal, brown sugar, pecans, chocolate chips, flax seeds, instant coffee granules, and cinnamon in a large bowl
Whisk applesauce, honey, egg, and vanilla extract in a small bowl; pour into oat mixture
Press batter into prepared baking dish
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes
Cool completely before cutting into granola bars
